deplorable and intellectually bankrupt to me. They both push for some 
reforms that I agree with (the later more than the former), but they are 
spearheaded by weirdo militants who are emotionally stunted and (seemingly)

members of these movements have differing views about "equality" is because

Both the men's right movements and modern feminism aren't worth much time. 
They both suffer from the same fundamental flaws: they want gender equality 
by focusing on the problems of one gender, they only focus on the problems 
of the other gender when it suits their respective causes, both are full of 
irrational people who think they're being rational, both don't take on any 
criticism of their movement, both want mainstream dominance and for their 
views to be heard, taught and accepted without scrutiny. Fuck that. On one 
side you have irrational people focusing on the problems of men, on the 
other side you have irrational people focusing on the problems of women. 
Cut out the irrationality, band together and just admit that there's gender 
inequities facing both sides and work as a rational collective with 
realistic approaches and goals to try and achieve a fairer, better off 
society. I consider myself politically post-modern and don't currently 
subscribe to any political movement, but if somehow we could get a rational 
collective, built on respect, understanding, determination, altruism, 
rationality, realism and a collective goal, I would fuckin' be up for that 
in a heartbeat. That's a political movement I'd subscribe to. I really do 
want a social equilibrium, but we have to just accept the fact that neither 
movements are going to get us there, in fact, with the animosity both 
movements create between the genders, they're more corrosive than anything. 
And before anyone says "But feminism is a movement that focuses on the 
inequalities of both genders", no, it really isn't. That mantra gets 
repeated over and over again, but in reality, it's a movement that 
exclusively focuses on the problems of one gender, while paying lip-service 
to the problems of the other for it's own gain, without real intent or 
sincerity to actually fight against those problems. ﻿

+Nat Revill +Modestoney  it all comes down to what you mean by "good, 
productive shit".
There were 3 waves of feminism, the first (XIX century to mid XX), was 
mostly about the formal achievement of civil rights such as the right of 
property ownership and inheritance, voting and being employed; because it 
believed in gender equality.
The second wave (since ww2's end) was more radical but also biologicist. It 
opposed pornography, and it also opposed transwomen; it was mostly a 
reaction to women's social role in cold war era "western world"; they 
anyway achieved some stuff on the legal plain.
3rd wave feminism (since the 90's) is structuralist influenced 
(structuralism is an academic movement that opposes positivism by focusing 
in structures rather than uninterpreted content; examples are lacanian 
psychoanalysis and semiotic literary criticism) and focuses mostly on 
non-formal women issues (those problems that are not a direct consequence 
of written law), like sexual abuse, mysoginy, reproduction. It opposes 2nd 
wave feminism, mostly on debates about sex and sexuality depiction (2nd 
wave somehow think sex and pornography are degrading to women; 3rd wave 
says sex it's good and healthy as long as the people involved want to do 
it, they're also pro-porn); and also on the subject of transexualism (2nd 
wave believes transwoman are men trying to "steal" women's place; 3rd wave 
believes genitals do not play a magic part in the social and political life 
of a person, but only, and marginally, when having sex, therefore they 
support transexuals).
So, FEMINISM IS NOT AN IDEOLOGY, but a lot of different, and sometimes 
completely opposite, ideologies (be it bourgeois representative democracy, 
classical marxism, biological determinism, structuralism, post-modernist 
deconstruction), all wrapped up in a political women's movement. The goal 
of feminism (at least current 3rd wave) IS NOT to impose a monolythic 
men-hating ideology, an idea that people keep repeating hoping it will 
someday become true, but to allow women to self-represent themselves 
politically (following a broad, non-formal, definition of politics as "any 
attempt by a determined subject directed at the conciliation of its 
objective material conditions and its subjective ideological conditions").
That's what feminism IS. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Feminism is a good source 
for reading about this. If you're interested on discussing these subjects, 
let's do it. I'm always up for a good discussion, what I'm not into is 
misinformed bigotry.

Where feminist demands break down:

1.) Equal Pay
The fact is women make the same amount for the same work as men. 
Both a male and female pediatrician with the same experience, same 
education, and same level of performance, who are both working the same 
hours, for the same employer are both going to make the same salary. The 
pay difference occurs when one of the two varies. Generally regardless of 
sex if you have more experience, better performance, or work longer hours, 
you will make more money.
 
Feminism ignores this though and treats any case of a women making less 
immediately as discrimination, never looking at any factors that cause the 
difference. Worse is the feminist demand for equal pay for “equivalent” 
education. What that means is if a man has a four year degree in 
engineering and goes to work for an engineering firm making 60,000.00 a 
year, then a women with a four year degree in sociology should also make 
60,00.00 a year working for the same company, despite the difference in 
degrees or their relevant positions in the company. This is of course a 
ridiculous request to make, but feminists refuse to use logic.

Feminism also treats a woman’s choice to not work or to work less as a 
result of societal pressure and not an actual choice. This is offensive to 
all women for it suggests women are incapable of making rational choices 
without feminist guidance.

healthier, women live longer, there are more women than men alive today, 
there are more women in college than men and much, much more!

On the other hand, feminism is constantly decrying how women are 
subjugated, humiliated, controlled, put down, beaten, raped, murdered, 
uneducated, and have just about every disadvantaged you could think of to 
overcome. How can women be both the ultimate victims and the ultimate sex 
at the same time? The simple answer is they can not and of course they are 
neither the ultimate victims or the ultimate sex either. Women and men have 
a necessary symbiotic relationship. We need each other to not only survive 
but to thrive as a species. The “who is better” debate reeks of immaturity 
because it is immature and shows a monumental lack of thinking.

Women would have to start dying years earlier, women would have to start

I'm going to play devils advocate.

If by "patriarchy", someone means "A system where most of the people in 
positions of power are men", then that is accurate.

Once the topic turns to things like "the system was set up by men, for the 
benefit of men, at the expense of women", it is on extremely shaky ground.

But the concept of patriarchy, is accurate.
As is the idea that there are currently big changes occurring in the social 
structure.

This structure where strictly men are seen as leaders (a traditional 
society) are also the product of other factors in addition to biology, 
which are more important than biology.

For example, in past horticultural societies, men and women had more equal 
power. Horticultural societies are ones where food was grown via planting 
with your hands or a digging stick. In such civilisations, there were an 
equal number of male and female gods. Men and women both had roughly equal 
levels of social respect. Great mother religions saw women as very 
powerful. Why? Because that technology created civilization structures 
where women WERE powerful. The cultural beliefs and genetic express 
reflected this fact.

Then the technology advanced, and an animal drawn plough was the cutting 
edge. This greatly increase food production. However, unlike before, men 
were significantly better suited to this. Why? Because it's hard physical 
work, large animals and a plough are demanding to operate and a pregnant 
woman was much more likely to miscarry if she did this work. That creates a 
very different world to the previous one where planting could be done 
equally be men and women. Suddenly, 90% of the gods are male. Men are seen 
as more powerful (because they WERE better at producing food). Surpluses 
also lead to the ability to go to war and gain more territory / resources. 
Men were put in charge of this by society, because men were better at it.

Then comes the industrial revolution, combustion engine, electricity, 
science etc. Suddenly it's not so much about physical strength, rather the 
mind. It also frees up more resources to spread education and end slavery. 
The strict roles of men and women began changing.

Now we have the information age, where the dominant force isn't just the 
mind, it's also the ability to network and connect and communicate. Women 
arguably have an advantage there, or at the absolute minimum are even.

Many people and ideas (and social structures) are still stuck in long 
surpassed positions. Fundamentalist Christianity was the cutting edge 1000 
years ago. Now it seems ancient.
But the forces are still lingering. People see that actually women can do 
the vast majority of jobs, they don't have to stay at home if they don't 
want to.

Of course, most people are completely unaware of this ongoing natural 
evolution in culture and systems and morality. They just see that some 
people asserting very strict gender roles, when it is actually obvious that 
suddenly women can also perform the opposite role. They come up with some 
type of mental ideas about why it was so in the past. The most obvious 
change is in women's ability to work and participate in the outside world.

There has been a bigger shift in women's ability to work, than there has 
been in men's ability to be a parent. I think this is partly explained by

Both men and women have issues. Yet due to our human biology and past

+Mentalidade Logica  I saw your original post before you edited, and you 
were still going on about how false accusations ruin lives. Nobody is 
disagreeing with that. A genuine false accusation is horrible for anyone, 
male or female. Likewise, being the victim of a genuine rape is horrible 
for anyone, male or female. Let me try to spell it out as simply as 
possible:

1) If there is strong evidence for a rape, then it should go to trial, even 
though the evidence might not ultimately convince the jury 'beyond 
reasonable doubt' - the whole point of due process.

2) If there is strong evidence for a false accusation, then it should go to 
trial, even though the evidence might not ultimately convince the jury 
'beyond reasonable doubt' - the whole point of due process. This can and 
does happen, and people have been jailed for false accusations.

3) What you apparently struggle to understand: where someone goes to trial, 
and is found not guilty because the evidence doesn't convince the jury 
'beyond reasonable doubt', that doesn't PROVE the witnesses and victims 
lied. It just shows that the evidence for convicting the defendant wasn't 
100% conclusive.

but in the end the only evidence against the defendant is your testimony, 
and the court decides they don't trust you enough to reach a guilty 
verdict. Does that automatically mean you lied? Does it mean you deserve to 
be punished for lying?

*Examples of female privilege*
1. Female privilege is being able to walk down the street at night without 
people crossing the street because they’re automatically afraid of you.

2. Female privilege is being able to approach someone and ask them out 
without being labeled “creepy.”

3. Female privilege is being able to get drunk and have sex without being 
considered a rapist. Female privilege is being able to engage in the same 
action as another person but be considered the innocent party by default.

4. Female privilege is being able to turn on the TV and see yourself 
represented in a positive way. Female privilege is shows like King of 
Queens and Everybody Loves Raymond where women are portrayed as attractive, 
competent people while men are shown as ugly, lazy slobs.

5. Female privilege is the idea that women and children should be the first 
rescued from any sort of emergency situation. Female privilege is saving 
yourself before you save others and not being viewed as a monster.

6. Female privilege is being able to decide not to have a child.

7. Female privilege is not having to support a child financially for 18 
years when you didn’t want to have it in the first place.

8. Female privilege is never being told to “take it like a man” or “man up.”

9. Female privilege is knowing that people would take it as a gravely 
serious issue if someone raped you. Female privilege is being able to laugh 
at a “prison rape” joke.

10. Female privilege is being able to divorce your spouse when your 
marriage is no longer working because you know you will most likely be 
granted custody of your children.

11. Female privilege is being able to call the police in a domestic dispute 
knowing they will take your side. Female privilege is not having your 
gender work against where police are involved.

12. Female privilege is being able to be caring or empathetic without 
people being surprised.

13. Female privilege is not having to take your career seriously because 
you can depend on marrying someone who makes more money than you do. Female 
privilege is being able to be a “stay at home mom” and not seem like a 
loser.

14. Female privilege is being able to cry your way out of a speeding ticket.

15. Female privilege is being favored by teachers in elementary, middle and 
high school. Female privilege is graduating high school more often, being 
accepted to more colleges, and generally being encouraged and supported 
along the way.

16. Female privilege being able to have an opinion without someone tell you 
you’re just “a butthurt fedora-wearing neckbeard who can’t get any.”

17. Female privilege is being able to talk about sexism without appearing 
self-serving.

18. Female privilege is arrogantly believing that sexism only applies to 
women.

*Now, on to legal privileges women enjoy that men do not*

1. Women are the assumed victim of domestic violence when police respond, 
even if the man is the one who makes the call saying he was the one abused. 
Also, that happens even though it has been shown that women are also the

+zachary davis Asking someone to describe what "real feminism" means is 
like asking someone to describe "real Christianity".  There are so many 
facets that various ideologies disagree on.  For example, some people still 
follow second-wave feminism, which has garnered itself the reputation of 
being man-haters and for white women only.  This wave shamed women who 
enjoyed doing housework and who wanted to be housewives.  The present day 
feminism is about equality and intersectionality.  Understanding that the 
issues a black straight woman faces are different than the ones a white 
lesbian faces, but believing that they are both equal and deserve basic 
human respects and rights.  Feminism sounds simple because anyone can claim 
to be one, but the hardest part about being a FEMINIST is understanding 
privilege and that our society, from government regulations down to school 
yard politics is designed to empower white men, and white men ONLY.  For 
more information please look to the articles on www.everydayfeminism.com.

Do you understand statistics? You showed me evidence that a cashier has a 2 
in 100,000 chance of dying at work in one year. That means an individual 
cashier has a 0.002% chance of dying at work in a particular year. A 
warehouse worker on the other hand has a 7 in 100,000 chance or a 0.007% 
chance of dying at work. The difference, in real terms, is 0.005%. In other 
words, both a cashier and a warehouse worker would have to be extremely 
unlucky to be killed at work. Both occupations are actually very safe. 

In case you still don't get it, let me use an example I saw in Ben 
Goldacre's book about media approaches to science. Someone released 
statistics to show that taking a certain pill increased the risk of heart 
attack by 100%. The media were all over it: this pill doubles your risk of 
heart attack! So people stopped taking the pill, which was for some other 
condition, and they began to die of the other condition. What was the 
truth? The pill did increase the risk of heart attack by 100%... from about 
0.01% to 0.02%. It was still a tiny, tiny risk. 'Doubled' or '100% 
increase' made it sound far more dramatic than it actually was. This is 
exactly what you are doing with your cashier versus warehouse statistics.

Your argument about having to bribe people to do risky jobs is also 
dubious. At least in the UK, there are scores of people competing for every 
low skilled job on offer. Warehouse work is ideal for someone whose 
aptitudes lie in physical work rather than the more social/cognitive work 
at the cash till. An infinitesimal risk factor (0.007% for Chrissake!) is 
not going to put people off.
